name: 30 Ari B
scenarioDescription:
The 30 Ari B Exoplanetary System


Overview

30 Ari B is a star with 1.93 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.41 times its radius. It is located 145.82 light years away from the solar system.

30 Ari B is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the 30 Ari B system


30 Ari B b

30 Ari B b was discovered by the Thueringer Landessternwarte Tautenburg observatory using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 0.99 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of 30 Ari B b is 4394.76 times the mass of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, 30 Ari B b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system 30 Ari B, which contains 1 planets and was discovered by Thueringer Landessternwarte Tautenburg.
